page.title: 09The Life of a Stud Manager
page.content: 6:00 a.m. Looks at mares and feeds them. 7:00 a.m. The vet arrives and looks for suitable mares to be covered. 9:00 a.m. Stud manager,vet and grooms,closely supervise coverings and in the most sterile conditions. lunch_time Mares are led out to paddocks for the rest of the day (weather permitting). afternoon Blacksmith comes to check the horses and the mares and foals exercise in the paddocks. evening Close vigil is kept by stud manager and staff waiting for signs of mares to begin foaling. Vet arrives if needed.
